snippet: Months after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo created a panel to investigate corruption in Albany, the efforts are burdened by resistance from the Legislature and unexpected pressure by the governor’s office.
abstract: Commission to Investigate Public Corruption, created by New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, has found itself burdened by resistance from New York State Legislature, which has refused requests for information about lawmakers’ outside income; also slowing panel up is unexpected involvement from governor’s office, which has leaned on the commission to limit the scope of its investigations.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and THOMAS KAPLAN
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Thomas Kaplan from New York.

lead_paragraph: Months after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo created a panel to investigate corruption in Albany, the efforts are burdened by resistance from the Legislature and unexpected pressure by the governor’s office.

headline.main: Cuomo’s Office Is Said to Rein In Ethics Board He Created
headline.print_headline: Cuomo’s Office Is Said to Rein In Ethics Board He Created

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
